meanings.sent1: The huffier cat strutted around like it owned the place.
meanings.sent2: She always acted huffier than everyone else in the room.
meanings.sent3: The huffier peacock thought it was the most important bird in the zoo.
meanings.sent4: His huffier attitude made him seem untouchable to others.
meanings.sent5: The huffier king believed no one could challenge his authority.

meanings.sent1: The huffier child refused to share his toys with anyone.
meanings.sent2: She became even huffier after receiving praise for her work.
meanings.sent3: His huffier behavior annoyed his friends during the game.
meanings.sent4: The huffier student thought he knew more than the teacher.
meanings.sent5: The huffier actress demanded special treatment on set.

meanings.sent1: Her huffier tone indicated she was not in the mood to talk.
meanings.sent2: He gave a huffier response than expected when asked about his day.
meanings.sent3: The huffier customer complained about the service at the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The huffier driver honked loudly at the slow-moving car.
meanings.sent5: The huffier cat hissed at the unfamiliar dog in its territory.

meanings.definition: To blow or puff out loudly
meanings.sent1: He huffiered out a cloud of smoke from his pipe.
meanings.sent2: The wind huffiered through the trees on the stormy night.
meanings.sent3: The child huffiered out the candles on the birthday cake.
meanings.sent4: The steam huffiered from the kettle on the stove.
meanings.sent5: She huffiered out a sigh of relief after finishing her exam.

meanings.sent1: After running, she huffiered as she tried to catch her breath.
meanings.sent2: The exhausted dog huffiered after chasing the ball in the park.
meanings.sent3: He huffiered from climbing the steep hill in the hot sun.
meanings.sent4: The old man huffiered as he struggled to lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent5: The hiker huffiered up the mountain trail, feeling the strain in his legs.
